key_risks: Class action lawsuits alleging artificial demand and panic buying during COVID-19
Economic sensitivity due to reliance on discretionary spending
Seasonality leading to financial performance fluctuations
Supply chain vulnerabilities including raw material shortages and transportation delays
Intense market competition in the pool and spa care industry
controversies: Multiple class action lawsuits covering February 5, 2021, to July 13, 2023
Allegations of unfair labor practices, including restrictive arbitration agreements
environmental_issues: Introduction of eco-friendly product lines as part of sustainability efforts
social_issues: Allegations of unfair labor practices and restrictive arbitration agreements
governance_issues: Amended and restated employment agreements, including for CEO Michael R. Egeck

sources.title: New lawsuit against Leslie's Pool Supply
sources.snippet: Leslie's Pool Supply is in hot water with its shareholders. A new lawsuit has been filed against the individual directors and officers of the swimming pool supply company, Leslie's Inc. The lawsuit, which was filed in March, accuses the officers of Leslie's of breaching their financial duties by making false and misleading statements or omissions from February 2022 through July 2023.
